review: This product was very disappointing and returned almost immediately. The main issue surrounds the device's ability to establish and maintain a proper Internet connection. After connecting to the Internet, it could not (for some unknown reason) contact Amazon. I found out how to reboot the thing and that seemed to work. Then, while scrolling through the content it abruptly lost connectivity. It displayed a message with "unknown error" so I rebooted again. I started a movie to seem how it would work and about 10 minutes in, it lost connectivity again. It suggested that the signal strength wasn't strong enough or the Internet connection was too slow. When actually, the problem is this horribly manufactured device. Yes the signal has to go through a couple walls to reach the router, it still had 4 out of 5 bars when displayed on the TV. And my Internet connection is very fast (40mbps d/l, 15mbps u/l). I had to return it. I'll just use the XBOX to stream content.
author: Listener

review: Make sure your broadband is fast enough for the sticks' needs or it won't work. How fast? I couldn't find a spec online, and the stick description doesn't address the issue. My broadband is 2.6mbps and is too slow. The stick refuses to even try to stream anything but the main menu.
author: Bill Robinson

review: It's ok. It has things about it that I like such as the ability to navigate between Hulu and Netflix without having to do extra work. BUT...Youtube moves extremely slow, both Hulu and Netflix often pauses as you are watching tv. It's almost like you have slow internet speed...BUT...I have the highest internet plan and this shouldn't be a problem. BUT IT IS. Fix these minor glitches, make them free to those who already have the stick to upgrade and i'll give you 5 stars.

review: I've used several devices to stream media including smart TVs, Roku, Xbox, Playstation, custom Raspberry Pi device, and this is by far my favorite. The interface is great and response, controller is intuitive (I can use it in the dark without having to look at it). It is small and I don't see it when plugged in to the TV. It always JUST WORKS, and streams via wifi with no hiccups. I would recommend this to ANYONE.
